@graph.involvedParties: Weyerhaeuser Co. v. Ross-Simmons Hardwood Lumber Co.
Plaintiff seeking to establish competitive injury resulting from a rival's low prices
@graph.reasoning: Must prove that prices complained of are below an appropriate measure of its rival's costs
Recognizing the centrality of recoupment to a predatory-pricing scheme
Primary-line competitive injury under the Robinson-Patman Act is of the same general character as the injury inflicted by predatory pricing schemes actionable under ยง 2 of the Sherman Act

@graph.involvedParties: Low prices benefit consumers regardless of how those prices are set
@graph.reasoning: Discouraging a price cut and depriving consumers of the benefits of lower prices does not constitute sound antitrust policy
Bids up the market price of a critical input to such high levels that rival buyers cannot survive
Market power on the buy side of the market
A proposed antitrust approach to buyers' competitive conduct
